intro: Vahlia somalensis, commonly known as the Somali vahlia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Somalia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are usually small and elliptical, and it produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. Vahlia somalensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to harsh environments.
